definition: (literary) to practice medicine/to work as a pharmacist
to hang or suspend/to worry/public announcement/unresolved/baseless/without foundation
practice medicine or pharmacy to help the people or public
practice medicine or pharmacy to help the people or public
to practice medicine (esp. in private practice)
benevolent heart and skillful execution (idiom, from Mencius); charitable in thought and deed

forest of apricot trees/fig. honorific term for fine doctor (cf Dr Dong Feng 董奉, 3rd century AD, asked his patients to plant apricot trees instead of paying fees)/Xinglin district of Xiamen city (renamed Haicang 海沧区 in 2003)
Sun Simiao (c. 581-682), doctor and herbalist of the Sui and Tang dynasty, author of Prescriptions Worth a Thousand in Gold 千金要方[Qian1 jin1 Yao4 fang1]
Dong Feng, doctor during Three Kingdoms period, famous for refusing fees and requesting that his patients plant apricot trees instead
all kinds of grass/all kinds of flora
